pyslfp.finger_print¶

Module for the FingerPrint class that allows for forward and adjoint elastic fingerprint calculations.

class pyslfp.finger_print.FingerPrint(*, lmax: int = 256, earth_model_parameters: EarthModelParameters | None = None, grid: str = 'DH', love_number_file: str = '/home/david/dev/pyslfp/pyslfp/data/love_numbers/PREM_4096.dat')[source]¶

Bases: EarthModelParameters

Computes elastic sea level “fingerprints” for a given surface load.

A sea level fingerprint is the unique pattern of sea level change that results from a change in a surface load, such as the melting of an ice sheet. This class solves the sea level equation, accounting for Earth’s elastic response, gravitational self-consistency, and rotational feedbacks.

The background state (sea level and ice thickness) must be set via a method like set_state_from_ice_ng before calculations can be performed.

adjoint_angular_momentum_change_from_adjoint_gravitational_potential_load(gravitational_potential_load: SHGrid) → ndarray[source]¶

Returns the adjoint angular momentum change for a given gravitational potential load.

adjoint_loads_for_displacement_point_measurement(latitude: float, longitude: float, smoothing_angle: float | None = None) → Tuple[None, SHGrid, None, None][source]¶

Returns the adjoint loads for a displacement point measurement.

adjoint_loads_for_gravitational_potential_coefficient(l: int, m: int) → Tuple[None, None, SHGrid, ndarray][source]¶

Returns adjoint loads for an observation of a gravitational potential coefficient.

adjoint_loads_for_gravity_potential_coefficient(l: int, m: int) → Tuple[None, None, SHGrid, None][source]¶

Returns adjoint loads for an observation of a gravity potential coefficient.

adjoint_loads_for_sea_level_point_measurement(latitude: float, longitude: float, smoothing_angle: float | None = None) → Tuple[SHGrid, None, None, None][source]¶

Returns the adjoint loads for a sea level point measurement.

altimetry_projection(latitude1: float = -66.0, latitude2: float = 66.0, value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 in the oceans between specified latitudes (typical for satellite altimetry) and value elsewhere.

as_linear_operator(order: float, scale: float, /, *, rotational_feedbacks: bool = True, rtol: float = 1e-06) → LinearOperator[source]¶

Returns the sea level fingerprint model as a pygeoinf LinearOperator.

This method wraps the instance’s physical forward model (the __call__ method) and its corresponding adjoint into a formal mathematical operator, which can be used in the solution of inverse problems.

Parameters:

  • order – The Sobolev order, defining the smoothness of the input load space.

  • scale – The Sobolev scale, defining the characteristic length scale of features in the input load space.

  • rotational_feedbacks – Configures the operator to include the effects of polar wander in the forward and adjoint calculations.

  • rtol – The relative tolerance passed to the underlying iterative solver.

Returns:

A pygeoinf.LinearOperator object that encapsulates the forward mapping, the adjoint mapping, and the mathematical spaces (domain and codomain).

property background_set: bool¶

Returns true is background state has been set.

centrifugal_potential_change(angular_velocity_change: ndarray) → SHGrid[source]¶

Computes the centrifugal potential change from an angular velocity change.

coefficient_evaluation(f: SHGrid, l: int, m: int) → float[source]¶

Return the (l,m)-th spherical harmonic coefficient of a function.

Parameters:

  • f – The function to get the coefficient from.

  • l – The degree.

  • m – The order.

Returns:

The value of the (l,m) coefficient.

constant_grid(value: float) → SHGrid[source]¶

Return a grid of a constant value.

property csphase: int¶

Return Condon-Shortley phase option.

direct_load_from_ice_thickness_change(ice_thickness_change: SHGrid) → SHGrid[source]¶

Converts an ice thickness change into the associated surface mass load.

disk_load(delta: float, latitude: float, longitude: float, amplitude: float) → SHGrid[source]¶

Return a circular disk load.

Parameters:

  • delta – Radius of the disk in degrees.

  • latitude – Latitude of the disk’s center in degrees.

  • longitude – Longitude of the disk’s center in degrees.

  • amplitude – Amplitude of the load.

displacement_love_numbers() → ndarray[source]¶

Return the displacement Love numbers, h.

property extend: bool¶

True if grid extended to include 360 degree longitude.

gaussian_averaging_function(r: float, latitude: float, longitude: float, cut: bool = False) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a Gaussian averaging function centered at a point.

Parameters:

  • r – Radius of the averaging function in kilometers.

  • latitude – Latitude of the center in degrees.

  • longitude – Longitude of the center in degrees.

  • cut – If true, the function is high-pass filtered by removing l<2.

gravitational_love_numbers() → ndarray[source]¶

Return the gravitational Love numbers, k.

gravitational_potential_change_to_gravity_potential_change(gravitational_potential_change: SHGrid, angular_velocity_change: ndarray) → SHGrid[source]¶

Adds the centrifugal potential to get the total gravity potential.

gravity_potential_change_to_gravitational_potential_change(gravity_potential_change: SHGrid, angular_velocity_change: ndarray) → SHGrid[source]¶

Subtracts the centrifugal potential to isolate the gravitational potential.

property grid: str¶

Return spatial grid option.

ice_projection(value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 over ice sheets and value elsewhere.

property ice_thickness: SHGrid¶

Returns the background ice thickness grid.

integrate(f: SHGrid) → float[source]¶

Integrate a function over the surface of the sphere.

Parameters:

f – The function to integrate, represented as an SHGrid object.

Returns:

The integral of the function over the surface.

land_projection(value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 over land and value elsewhere.

lats() → ndarray[source]¶

Return the latitudes for the spatial grid.

property lmax: int¶

Return truncation degree for expansions.

load_response(load: SHGrid) → Tuple[SHGrid, SHGrid][source]¶

Returns the direct elastic deformation for a load.

Note

This calculation does not account for the sea level equation (i.e., no gravitationally self-consistent sea level change or rotational feedbacks).

Parameters:

load – The applied surface load.

Returns:

A tuple containing the vertical displacement and the gravitational potential change as SHGrid objects.

lons() → ndarray[source]¶

Return the longitudes for the spatial grid.

mean_sea_level_change(direct_load: SHGrid) → float[source]¶

Returns the mean sea level change from a direct load (eustatic change).

property normalization: str¶

Return spherical harmonic normalisation convention.

northern_hemisphere_load(fraction: float = 1.0) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a load from melting a fraction of Northern Hemisphere ice.

northern_hemisphere_projection(value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 in the Northern Hemisphere and value elsewhere.

property ocean_area: float¶

Returns the total ocean area.

ocean_average(f: SHGrid) → float[source]¶

Return the average of a function over the oceans.

property ocean_function: SHGrid¶

Returns the ocean function (1 over oceans, 0 elsewhere).

ocean_projection(value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 over oceans and value elsewhere.

property one_minus_ocean_function: SHGrid¶

Returns 1 - C, where C is the ocean function.

point_evaluation(f: SHGrid, latitude: float, longitude: float, degrees: bool = True) → float[source]¶

Evaluate a grid function at a specific point.

Parameters:

  • f – The function to evaluate.

  • latitude – The latitude of the point.

  • longitude – The longitude of the point.

  • degrees – If True, latitude and longitude are in degrees. Defaults to True.

Returns:

The value of the function at the specified point.

point_load(latitude: float, longitude: float, amplitude: float = 1.0, smoothing_angle: float | None = None) → SHGrid[source]¶

Return a point load, optionally smoothed with a Gaussian kernel.

Parameters:

  • latitude – Latitude of the point load in degrees.

  • longitude – Longitude of the point load in degrees.

  • amplitude – Amplitude of the load.

  • smoothing_angle – Angle in degrees for Gaussian smoothing.

property sea_level: SHGrid¶

Returns the background sea level grid.

set_state_from_ice_ng(*, version: IceModel = IceModel.ICE7G, date: float = 0.0) → None[source]¶

Sets the background state from an ICE-NG model.

Parameters:

  • version – The ice model version to use (e.g., IceModel.ICE7G).

  • date – The date in thousands of years before present (ka).

property solver_counter: int¶

Returns the number of times the __call__ solver method has been called.

southern_hemisphere_load(fraction: float = 1.0) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a load from melting a fraction of Southern Hemisphere ice.

southern_hemisphere_projection(value: float = nan) → SHGrid[source]¶

Returns a grid that is 1 in the Southern Hemisphere and value elsewhere.

zero_coefficients() → SHCoeffs[source]¶

Return a set of zero spherical harmonic coefficients.

zero_grid() → SHGrid[source]¶

Return a grid of zeros with compatible dimensions.
